item.title: Digital Design Studio Assistant - Tisch Library - Work Study or Non-Work Study at Tufts University
item.description:
Employer: Tufts University Expires: 04/04/2022
Digital Design Studio AssistantDescriptionThe Digital Design Studio is a educational resource for entry into digital design, supporting student course and research projects, as well as independent and extracurricular work by students, faculty, and staff. Currently, we primarily serve video, audio, and print design. Our biggest services are large-format printing; a recording room for basic audio and video needs; self-service digitization equipment for analog media formats like VHS, vinyl, and film negatives; and basic 3D printing. Our space has a teaching, learning, and studying area of 16 computers with the Adobe Creative Cloud and other design software.Studio Assistants are the first line of support in the studio, welcoming patrons and responding to their questions, as well as providing service for our large-format printing appointments and recording room reservations. Additionally, Studio Assistants clean, maintain, and troubleshoot the studio space. The position is primarily independent work with minimal supervision, but we provide training on our core services.ResponsibilitiesServe as a friendly representative of the space and our servicesAssist patrons with learning basic digital design skills, particularly for video, audio, and print Participate in trainings and continually improve your design and digital media skillsClean and maintain the studio space, including the recording room, teaching space, and printing and trimming areaServe patrons with large-format printing appointments, operate large-format printer for patronsFamiliarize first-time users with our recording room Assist patrons digitizing photographic prints, negatives, slides, VHS tapes, DVDs, CDs, etc.Work with DDS staff on projects such as creating signage, documentation, tutorials or helping to facilitate workshopsQualificationsRequiredInterest in learning design software and hardwareStrong commitment to outstanding public serviceAbie to work effectively with a culturally diverse communityAble to work approximately 6-10 hours a weekSelf-motivated learner who can work independently Able to occasionally lift up to 25 poundsPreferredCustomer service, teaching, or tutoring experience experienceInterest or practice in video, audio, and/or print designFamiliarity with or prior use of the Digital Design Studio and its servicesKnowledge of design software, particularly Adobe Premiere Pro, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe InDesign, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Audition, iMovie, Audacity, Canva, and TinkerCADKnowledge of photo and video cameras, audio recorders, microphones, and/or photograph and film scanningAccessibility InformationLocated on top floor, accessible by elevator. Some lifting required (25 lbs).
